Selain Kapolri, Jokowi Juga Akan Lantik 9 Komisioner Komisi Kejaksaan
01 Nov 2019, 06:35 by Jabbar Ramdhani
Jakarta - Pagi ini, Presiden Joko Widodo (Jokowi) juga akan melantik komisioner dari Komisi Kejaksaan RI (KKRI). Pelantikan digelar usai Jokowi melantik Komjen Idham Azis sebagai kapolri.
"Ya, besok akan ada pelantikan anggota Komisioner KKRI periode 2019-2023 setelah pelantikan Kapolri," kata anggota Komisi Kejaksaan RI 2015-2019, Indro Sugianto, saat dimintai konfirmasi, Kamis (31/10/2019) malam.
Berdasarkan informasi yang dihimpun, pelantikan akan digelar di Istana Negara, Jakarta, pukul 09.30 WIB. Akan ada sembilan orang komisioner Komisi Kejaksaan yang akan dilantik Jokowi.
Sembilan nama ini dipilih Jokowi dan ditetapkan dalam Keputusan Presiden Republik Indonesia Nomor 62/M Tahun 2019 tentang Pemberhentian dan Pengangkatan Keanggotaan Komisi Kejaksaan Republik Indonesia tertanggal 18 Oktober 2019.
Berikut nama-nama yang akan dilantik:
1. Barita LH Simanjuntak (Ketua merangkap anggota)
2. Babul Khoir (Wakil Ketua merangkap anggota)
3. Witono (anggota)
4. Sri Harijati (anggota)
5. Apong Herlina (anggota)
6. Resi Anna Napitupulu (anggota)
7. Muhammad Ibnu Mazjah (anggota)
8. Bambang Widarto (anggota)
9. Bhatara Ibnu Reza (anggota)
Dua bulan lalu, Ketua Panitia Seleksi (Pansel) Komisi Kejaksaan Basrief Arief menemui Menko Polhukam Wiranto. Basrief menyampaikan laporan hasil seleksi calon komisioner kejaksaan.
"Tadi kita melapor, bahwa Pansel Komisi Kejaksaan telah selesai melakukan tugasnya untuk menseleksi para peserta calon komisioner kejaksaan dan tinggal laporan ini diteruskan ke presiden untuk ditetapkan sebagai komisionernya," kata Basrief Arief di kantor Kemenko Polhukam, Jalan Medan Merdeka Barat, Jakarta Pusat, Rabu (28/8).
Basrief menjelaskan Pansel Komisi Kejaksaan telah memilih 12 nama dari 86 orang yang mendaftar Komisoner Kejaksaan. Dari 12 nama tersebut akan ditetapkan 6 orang komisioner.
Dia menegaskan pihaknya hanya menyeleksi calon komisioner Kejaksaan dari pihak masyarakat. Sedangkan dari pihak Kemenko Polhukam nantinya juga akan memberikan nama-nama Calon Komisioner Kejaksaan dari unsur pemerintah.
"Saya kira Pak Menko itu, dia sebagai yang memiliki kewenangan untuk menunjuk unsur dari pemerintah. Sementara kami ditunjuk presiden dengan Keppres 48/P 2 Mei 2019 untuk menseleksi dari unsur masyarakat. Jadi sesuai dengan Perpres itu, Pansel akan memilih 12, terakhir ya 12 orang untuk diserahkan melalui Menko kepada presiden itu akan ditetapkan presiden 6 sebagai komisioner kejaksaan, unsur masyarakat. Jadi ada dua unsur, unsur pemerintah dan unsur masyarakat. Unsur pemerintah itu nanti Menko langsung menunjuk 3 orang di sana," jelas Basrief.

(jbr/eva)

In addition to the National Police Chief, Jokowi will also appoint 9 commissioners to the prosecutors commission
01 Nov 2019, 06:35 by Jabbar Ramdhani
Jakarta - This morning, President Joko Widodo (Jokowi) will also appoint commissioners from the Indonesian Prosecutors' Commission (KKRI). The inauguration was held after Jokowi installed Komjen Idham Azis as National Police Chief.
"Yes, tomorrow there will be an inauguration of members of the Indonesian Commission for KKRI 2019-2023 after the inauguration of the National Police Chief," said Indonesian Prosecutors Commission member 2015-2019, Indro Sugianto, when asked for confirmation on Thursday (10/31/2019) night.
Based on information compiled, the inauguration will be held at the State Palace, Jakarta, at 09.30 WIB. There will be nine commissioners from the Prosecutors' Commission that Jokowi will appoint.
These nine names were chosen by Jokowi and stipulated in Presidential Decree of the Republic of Indonesia Number 62 / M of 2019 concerning Termination and Appointment of Membership of the Republic of Indonesia Prosecutors Commission dated October 18, 2019.
The following names will be inaugurated:
1. Barita LH Simanjuntak (Chair and member)
2. Babul Khoir (Deputy Chairperson and member)
3. Witono (member)
4. Sri Harijati (member)
5. Apong Herlina (member)
6. Receipt Anna Napitupulu (member)
7. Muhammad Ibnu Mazjah (member)
8. Bambang Widarto (member)
9. Bhatara Ibnu Reza (member)
Two months ago, the Chairperson of the Selection Committee (Pansel) of the Prosecutors' Commission, Basrief Arief, met with Coordinating Minister for Political, Legal and Security Affairs Wiranto. Basrief delivered a report on the selection of prospective prosecutors commissioners.
"Earlier we reported that the Prosecutor's Commission Committee had finished its task of selecting candidates for prosecutors commissioners and this report was left to the president to be appointed as its commissioner," Basrief Arief said at the office of the Coordinating Ministry for Politics and Security, Jalan Medan Merdeka Barat, Central Jakarta, Wednesday. (8/28).
Basrief explained that the Committee of the Prosecutors' Commission chose 12 names from 86 people who registered with the Prosecutor's Commissioner. Of the 12 names, six commissioners will be determined.
He stressed that his party only selected prospective prosecutors commissioners from the public side. Meanwhile, the Coordinating Ministry for Politics and Security will also give the names of prospective commissioners from the government.
"I think the Coordinating Minister, he as the one who has the authority to appoint elements from the government. While we were appointed by the president with Presidential Decree 48 / P 2 May 2019 to select from the elements of society. So according to the Perpres, the Pansel will choose 12, finally yes 12 "People to be handed over through the Coordinating Minister to the president will be appointed by President 6 as the prosecutorial commissioner, the element of society. So there are two elements, elements of government and elements of the government. The government will later appoint 3 people directly there," Basrief explained.
